newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Changchai to list 100 mln B shares Friday.
newsitem.headline: Changchai to list 100 mln B shares Friday.

text.p: Diesel engine maker Changchai Co Ltd has obtained the approval of the Shenzhen Stock Exchange to list 100 million class B shares on September 13, an official of the chief domestic underwriter said on Tuesday.
The Shenzhen J&A Securities official said the issue had been at least five times oversubscribed.

Changchai's offer of 100 million B shares for foreign investors was priced at HK$4.97 per share, carrying a projected price/earnings ratio of 7.46 times based on forecast net earnings per share of 0.715 yuan for 1996, the official said.
DBS Asia Capital Ltd was international coordinator, he said.
Changchai's chairman, Shen Tieping, earlier said Changchai planned to funnel the proceeds into expanding its diesel engine output and upgrading production facilities and technology.
Changchai aimed to expand its domestic market share to 40 percent by 2000 from the present 22.8 percent, Shen said.
Shen said Changchai expected to produce 1.60 million diesel engines this year, compared with 1.22 million units in 1995.

Following the B share issue, Changchai's total share capital expanded to 352 million shares, including 150.9 million state shares, 38 million legal person shares and 63 million class A shares for domestic investors.
